db-reverse.description:
generate models with database reverse engineering.

  Usage: merlin-gql db-reverse -h <host> -d <database> -p [port] -u <user> -x [password] -e [engine]

  You can also run program without specifying any parameters to launch interactive mode.

database.name: database
database.description: Database name(or path for sqlite). You can pass multiple values separated by comma.

schema.name: schema
schema.description: Schema name to create model from. Only for mssql and postgres. You can pass multiple values separated by comma eg. -s scheme1,scheme2,scheme3

cf.name: cf
cf.description: Convert file names to specified case

ce.name: ce
ce.description: Convert class names to specified case

cp.name: cp
cp.description: Convert property names to specified case

eol.name: eol
eol.description: Force EOL to be LF or CRLF

pv.name: pv
pv.description: Defines which visibility should have the generated property

skipSchema.name: skipSchema
skipSchema.description: Omits schema identifier in generated entities

disablePluralization.name: disablePluralization
disablePluralization.description: Disable pluralization of OneToMany, ManyToMany relation names

skipTables.name: skipTables
skipTables.description: Skip schema generation for specific tables. You can pass multiple values separated by comma

strictMode.name: strictMode
strictMode.description: Mark fields as optional(?) or non-null(!)

secureResolvers.name: secureResolvers
secureResolvers.description: Add security to Resolvers with @Secure decorator
